p: Silver has been recognized as an anti-infection agent since ancient times. Extensive research has been conducted on silver ions and silver conjugated salts as potential antimicrobial and anti-biofilm agents. Although silver has been used as a therapeutic agent, silver ions exhibit a level of toxicity and have low efficacy due to their inactivation caused by easily complexing with other molecules and their precipitation with other interfering salts ( Mohanty et al., 2017). New strategies to address these problems are being explored, such as the use of leaf extracts of ethnomedicinal plants to synthesize AgNPs in a cost effective, bio-compatible, and eco-friendly manner.
